main event: Two airmen at Brooks AFB observed a white disc-shaped object traveling at high altitude and speed on August 1, 1952.
interesting points: The object was described as a white disc with no protuberances, traveling straight and level at a high altitude.
The object was observed visually from the ground for approximately 1 to 1.5 minutes.
The object was observed by Airman 1st Class John R. Holl and Airman 2nd Class John E. Daniel, but their reliability was unknown.
There was no sound associated with the object, and it disappeared from view as it traveled away at a high rate of speed.
The report states there was no activity or condition, meteorological or otherwise, that could account for the sighting.
photographs: no, the report does not include any photographs
